subject: RE: [junit] Re: test collector for junit under ant?
msgSnippet: ... That s just stupid. At least *Test follows the general convention of appending the name of an interface implemented or class extended. I used *TestCase for
messageBody:
>So said Ilja Preuss on 2003-07-23 --------------------
>>> In the mean time, I've set it up
>>> using a naming convention ("**/*Test.class") in my test class tree,
>>> but that raises the possibility of missing a test due to a naming
>>> error.
>>
>> That's pretty rare. I wouldn't lose sleep over it.
>
>And it's certainly better than the naming convention I read about
>somewhere else ("XP cookbook", IIRC): **/Test*.class - just think about
>Testosterone.class... ;)

That's just stupid. At least *Test follows the general convention of appending the name of an interface implemented or class extended.

I used *TestCase for a while, but *Test is just as good.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
